channel.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
channel.description: Removed, nobody meets the requirements I guess.

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

The Outsider:

I just thought… you don’t need people like me telling you right from wrong… sorry I jumped down your throat like that. I wasn’t be rude, but now I feel I was. Regarding your PM: it’s cool.

I’m glad we could come to an understanding. I’m sorry as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @Pr0ject_pvp Pr0ject pvp
item.description:
@Pr0ject_pvp wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:10, topic:426129”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=528820.msg3857340#msg3857340 date=1324432738]
Was more refering to blakescape as you said you would start out with it. And why not save the hassle of cleaning 900kb of code and just use something more OOP like hyperion or apollo. Shards revolution is actually pretty nice, just dont see why you are fooling around with blakescape.

If you are 18 and get sued by Jagex, you will get pay full consequences

implying private servers are illegal.
www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff
[/quote]
My bad, IF He decides to put it up
and use the thousand dollars for server fees and it becomes popular, Jagex may do so.[/quote]
Holy shit that link is the coolest thing I have ever seen! 1 nil mopar! 0 nil jagex

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Team_Rocket:

I can see that I’m clearly not welcome here. I have no interest in “hacking” people, and I never said he lacked ability. Scouting is how I picked up our current team.

I wouldn’t go that far. They are just trying to give you constructive criticism and trying to help you out haha. Also doesn’t help that you have less than 200 rep and are a junior member.

Read full topic

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:30, topic:426129”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=528820.msg3857407#msg3857407 date=1324434331]

I can see that I’m clearly not welcome here. I have no interest in “hacking” people, and I never said he lacked ability. Scouting is how I picked up our current team.

Welcome? I’d say you are. Kids are brainwashed to think that anyone asking for their personal information is going to hurt them.

I just don’t understand why everyone is being so hostile towards me. I’ve never seen any community treat a new-comer like this. I don’t mean any disrespect to anyone.

Arrogance and fear. Come out to say you are high caliber, people are going to be pissed that the new guy is better than the vet. Normal reaction.
[/quote]

Oh, I understand. This wasn’t my intention or how I wanted to project myself at all of course. I’m just looking for another member for our Development Team. If I knew this would be the result, I would’ve kept “Scouting”.[/quote]

Think of it as a social experiment.

Read full topic

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

I mean if your going to go all out with a big team full of professionals, Make your Own MMO
Since you have so much “experience” I don’t see this going too far.
Probably a few months at most and that is about it.
Like 1000 dollar funding on a RSPS? Think bigger with the thousand buck you have.
Think out of the Box.

Read full topic

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:20, topic:426129”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=528820.msg3857378#msg3857378 date=1324433603]

Oh I don’t see this succeeding. You are taking the wrong approach.

If you have a better idea I’m all ears. Even if someone satisfies us with their answers to this thread, I doubt they’ll be accepted onto the team, because we’re going to be asking many more questions. We also require personal information such as phone numbers, address, ect.
[/quote]

Don’t turn it into a job, I was apart of a project where the guy wanted to put me on healthcare. Its just a very awkward situation. The way I suggest your team goes about this is trying to slowly scout people from their threads, their behavior and the like. If they seem like they are worth talking to then have a one on one private conversation. Talk about what you guys represent, what you do, the time commitment etc. Then if they pass that, have them communicate with the team and see how they function. Set up a small task, have them do that.

I went way too deep but the whole idea of scouting is a great approach to the quality that you want.[/quote]
Let them show there true colours. Anyone applying will be 12 years old attempting to brown nose you.

[quote] Oh, and sinisoul would run rings around most people here in programming. [/quote]

I’ve gotten my ass handed to me by frank_ and super_.


Hence why I said most.

Read full topic

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:17, topic:426129”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=528820.msg3857371#msg3857371 date=1324433413]
Oh I don’t see this succeeding. You are taking the wrong approach.
[/quote]

If you have a better idea I’m all ears. Even if someone satisfies us with their answers to this thread, I doubt they’ll be accepted onto the team, because we’re going to be asking many more questions. We also require personal information such as phone numbers, address, ect.[/quote]

Don’t turn it into a job, I was apart of a project where the guy wanted to put me on healthcare. Its just a very awkward situation. The way I suggest your team goes about this is trying to slowly scout people from their threads, their behavior and the like. If they seem like they are worth talking to then have a one on one private conversation. Talk about what you guys represent, what you do, the time commitment etc. Then if they pass that, have them communicate with the team and see how they function. Set up a small task, have them do that.

I went way too deep but the whole idea of scouting is a great approach to the quality that you want.

Oh, and sinisoul would run rings around most people here in programming.

I’ve gotten my ass handed to me by frank_ and super_.

The whole reason why they want personal information is for communication purposes. I can agree to that, its important. Hell if one of my employees vanished I want to know what is going on, so communication other than Forums, MSN, or IRC is important. Phones are not directly linked to here and if I want your phone number, then I will request for it. Like I said, especially if we are working together or you are working for me.

Read full topic

item.description:

You don’t need personal information. This could be a ploy to hack people. There’s no valid reason you need any of that, especially when we don’t know who the fuck you are. Oh, and sinisoul would run rings around most people here in programming.

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Oh I don’t see this succeeding. You are taking the wrong approach. Being professional, great. Being professional on Moparscape? Whoa, take a step back. Posting on Moparscape is weird in my mind as well. This forum has good developers, yes, but scouting the forum instead of posting would have been an easier. Most of the good people, don’t usually associate themselves with a forum anymore. Sure they come by, but they most likely won’t post here. They might come to you, or you come to them. With the amount of expectations, which aren’t hard to meet at all, you will see people who will set you back in the future applying.

Just sayin.

Read full topic

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

The fact that it’s become a franchise and people use the word “donate” as a way or selling in game items (not implying you will) is the reason why RS went to shit, it’s only a matter of time before RSPS crumbles.

Read full topic

item.title: Z-317 (High Requirements)
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

The Outsider:

Sorry to break the ice, but $1,000 is ridiculous and you shouldn’t be allowed to operate a server with that amount of money involved.

Another perk of having project members who’re 18+ is that we can have jobs. We also do some programming for people to earn more money. I don’t see why we shouldn’t be allowed to operate a server… if It’s because it won’t be fair to the other servers, I agree.

Read full topic
